message: What do you guys recommend as backend?  I'm thinking woosh is the easiest since its a python package?
@rasiel We don't support any of the backends yet, technically; whoosh and xapian both store to disk, and our disk storage has no locking/synchronous mode, so your results may vary.

We're working on getting Solr working, but it's no small task; in the interim, not sure what to recommend. Whoosh should be safe if you only commit to it from a single thread (i.e. you have a separate indexing process)
@rasiel Well, a celery queue could be more than one process in future, but it will be fine for now

@andrewgodwin thanks for getting back to me on this ... i've gone ahead and installed whoosh, though i havn't tested fully yet.  when you say commit to it from a single thread ... you mean like from a celery queue only?  right now i have a RealTimeSearchIndex, since its a relatively small site.
